activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Case called at 8:37 AM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant William A Jackson not in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by zoom for William A Jackson.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

It is learned that Mr. Jackson may be in transit to another facility; the Court adjourns preliminary hearing. 

recess: 8:42am

[ml] Cases 22CF157 and 22CF156 called at 8:33AM
Defendant Carter Smith appears via Zoom from the Stanley Correctional Facility, in custody and without counsel.
Defendant William Jackson does not appear. Att Cassi Nelson appears via Zoom.

As to file 22CF157:
Mr. Smith advises that he can see and hear the video connection.
Mr. Smith advises he continues to want counsel in these matters.
The Court finds good cause to continue to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits to allow for the Public Defender's Office to continue to try to appoint the Defendant counsel.
The Court sets this file over for Initial Appearance, and adjourns this file for today.


As to 22CF156:
Att Nelson informs the Court that Mr. Jackson will not be appearing today as he is attending court in another county, and requests that the Preliminary Hearing be rescheduled.

recess 8:40AM

[ae] case called 10:55 AM Defendant William A Jackson appeared by telephone in custody at Milwaukee House of Correction. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $5000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no presence at Walmart or Pick n Save in Watertown
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin

recess 11:03 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 5/31/22 at 9:00 am [Clerk is to notify SPD that defendant is requesting representation paperwork]
